2. Hello, World!

2.1 Programs

Program is a command which tells the computer what to do. Programming is an activity of writing and testing such programs. Computers are dumb, in the sense that they require instructions to complete a certain task that a human can do with common sense.The language in which instructions are given is programming language We would be using C++ as our programming language.

2.2 The classic first program

Classic Hello World Program 

                //This program outpts "Hello World" to the monitor
                #include < iostream >
                int main() {
                    cout <<"Hello, World!\n";
                    return 0;
                }

Let's understand the meaning of each line

  1. // This is a comment. It is ignored by the compiler.Written to make code more readable.
  2. #include is a directive, instructs compiler to include facilities from iostream
  3. The main is the function, from where the computer starts executing the code
  4. cout refers to standard output stream, it is an abbreviaton of "character output". character put in cout using << will appear on screen

Every C++ program should have a main function to tell from where to start executing the program. A function has four parts:

  1. return type specifies type of result that particular function would return to the callee. int here.
  2. name, here main
  3. Parameter list list of arguments the function takes.empty in the above example
  4. function body enclosed in curly braces,which lists the actions
2.3 Compilation

C++ is a compiled language which means that the code has to be translated to machine level instructions. Translation is done by a compiler

Source code is the code you write, for C++ the suffix is .cpp The machine code or object code, is .o (Unix) or .obj(Windows) Compiler checks for grammatically errors and/or syntax.

2.4 Linking

several parts of code must be compiled and the resulting code file must be linked together to form an executable. Linker links such parts together to form an executable.

object code and executables are not portable among systems. object code for windows will not run on Unix machines.

compile time errorserrors found by compilers link time errors errors found by linkers run time/logical errors found when program is run

2.5 Programming environments

To program we either use a command line or IDE. To write and run a program, we require a certain programming language, compiler, linker and an editor. when using command line, you need to compile and link code by writing commands

IDE (Intercative development Environment) has a simple click button, which performs the compile,link,run commands for you. IDE also has features like color coding to help distinguish between comments, keywords and other parts of program.

Debugging is used to find errors in program and remove them.
